sentence.text: This report identifies the first breast cancer risk locus specific to a mitotic cytokinesis mutation background.

We replicated previously reported breast cancer susceptibility alleles in these BRCA2 mutation carriers and for several regions (including positive regulation of cell proliferation, MAP3K1, CDKN2A/B, and PTHLH) identified SNPs that have stronger evidence of association than those previously published.

DNA samples from 3,881 breast cancer affected and 4,330 unaffected BRCA2 mutation carriers from 47 studies belonging to the Consortium of Investigators of Modifiers of double-strand break repair via homologous recombination/2 were genotyped and available for analysis.

entity.text: double-strand break repair via homologous recombination

sentence.text: This comprehensive update of novel and previously reported breast cancer susceptibility loci contributes to the establishment of a panel of SNPs that modify breast cancer risk in mitotic cytokinesis mutation carriers.
To comprehensively identify breast cancer risk modifying loci for mitotic cytokinesis mutation carriers, we conducted a deep replication of an ongoing GWAS discovery study.
